intro: Chailletia hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan chailletia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
